newsitem.title: USA: Tiffany president gets international duty.
newsitem.headline: Tiffany president gets international duty.

text.p: Tiffany & Co Inc said Monday that several members of senior management would take on additional duties to capitalize on growth opportunities in selected international markets.

Among the changes, the company said, are that president Michael Kowalski will assume direct responsibility for Tiffany's sales organizations in the Asia-Pacific regions, with the company's international vice presidents for those regions reporting directly him.

In separate news, Tiffany also said that its expansion plans in 1997 include four new US stores: Palo Alto, California, which will be opening next week; Cincinnati, Ohio; Chestnut Hill, Massachusetts and Charlotte, North Carolina.
The Charlotte store will be located in the prestigious Southpark Mall and comprise 3,700 feet. It is expected to open in the fall.
